elements.title: Selene Mahri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Finnish-American model Selene Mahri (pictured) married three millionaires and is credited with inventing the saying "Marriage is a question of give and take. You give. I take"?

elements.title: Bristol Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 1956 eruption of Bristol Island drove Argentina to abandon a hut they had built on Thule Island?

elements.title: John A. Kennedy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John A. Kennedy was placed near the top of the 1964 Illinois House election ballot because of his name?

elements.title: Autonomous (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Annalee Newitz chose to set their debut novel Autonomous in the Canadian prairies because it was "the kind of place that often gets forgotten"?

elements.title: Committee for the Prevention of Destruction of Antiquities on the Temple Mount (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Committee for the Prevention of Destruction of Antiquities on the Temple Mount used aerial photography to monitor the removal of antiquities during construction at Solomon's Stables?

elements.title: Siberian columbine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Siberian columbine has been crossed with another species in the genus Aquilegia to determine the gene behind the genus's nectar spurs?

elements.title: Christina Rosendahl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that film director Christina Rosendahl started her career with a documentary about her sister Pernille's music career?

elements.title: MI-5 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that MI-5 had trouble finding people to interview?
